title: BoJ's Kuroda says inflation will accelerate "considerably", on track to meet target
text:

Wed, Jul 22, 2015, 06:02 BST - UK Markets open in 1 hr 58 mins BoJ's Kuroda says inflation will accelerate "considerably", on track to meet target By Jessica Fino | Sharecast – 11 hours ago Print 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Japanese inflation is expected to accelerate "considerably" in the coming months, the Bank of Japan's governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Tuesday. Addressing a press conference, Kuroda said inflation is still on track to meet the central bank's 2% forecast by the end of 2016. 
Meanwhile, the BoJ said that Japan's economic recovery was on track, according to the minutes of its June meeting. But several board members said the impact of the bank's economic stimulus might be "diminishing". 
However, members noted the inflation scenario will continue to improve in the long term. "Japan's economy has continued to recover moderately. Overseas economies, mainly advanced economies, have been recovering, albeit with a lackluster performance still seen in part," the minutes said. Follow the quotes you care about most.
